entry.title: Panama cross-banded tree frog (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Panama cross-banded tree frog (pictured) males synchronize their mating calls to confuse predators that locate them by sound?

entry.title: Dale Haney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dale Haney has walked presidential pooches from Richard Nixon's King Timahoe to Joe Biden's Commander and safeguarded George W. Bush's pets during the September 11 attacks?

entry.title: Japanese jazz cafés (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Japanese jazz cafés often require customers to be silent?

entry.title: Grace Glueck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1969 note from New York Times writer Grace Glueck to Arthur Ochs Sulzberger spurred a class-action lawsuit over gender discrimination?

entry.title: alt attribute (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that organizations have been successfully sued for not using the alt attribute correctly on their websites?

entry.title: Antinous (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Roman emperor Hadrian was so grieved by the death of his male lover Antinous that he made him into a god and founded a city in his honour?

entry.title: a Seattle radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kurt Cobain gave a Seattle radio station a copy of his first single, then called from a pay phone to request it after it went unplayed?

entry.title: went from "astonishing" to "explosive" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Liz Truss's rise to power went from "astonishing" to "explosive" a day before she resigned as prime minister?
